user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_post_process:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_post_process (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp,
                  const char *post_data,
                  size_t post_data_len)
{
  if (0 == post_data_len)
    return MHD_YES;
  if (NULL == pp)
    return MHD_NO;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_FORM_URLENCODED)))
    return post_process_urlencoded (pp,
                                    post_data,
                                    post_data_len);
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_n_ (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_MULTIPART_FORMDATA,
                                 pp->encoding,
                                 MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (
                                   MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_MULTIPART_FORMDATA)))
    return post_process_multipart (pp,
                                   post_data,
                                   post_data_len);
  /* this should never be reached */
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_post_process (struct MHD_PostProcessor *pp,
                  const char *post_data,
                  size_t post_data_len)
explanation: The remaining code fragments do not raise concerns under MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13: post_data is already declared as const char *, so it is correctly const-qualified; post_data_len is a scalar size_t (not a pointer) and therefore not subject to this rule; the early-return checks (if (0 == post_data_len) and if (NULL == pp)) are control-flow/validation and not pointer-type issues; the string constants and macros (MHD_HTTP_POST_ENCODING_*, MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_) represent constant data and are appropriately used as constant inputs. The only potential const-qualification issues are with the pointer to the post-processor object (pp) and uses of its encoding member passed to comparison functions — these are listed above for investigation because they might be candidates for const-qualification or may legitimately require mutability (which callers should justify).
